The players then total up the number of points scored by each competitor on the basis of 5 points for each completed game, with the exception of the 'marathon' game (denoted by letter M) which qualifies for 10 points.

The Joker can be used at any stage of the game to complete the other half of a two card 'game', but this particular game only qualifies for standard points, i.e.5 If the Joker card is laid on top of a matching 2 card game this entitles the player to double points for the one 'game', i.e.10 points. The player with the highest number of points is declared the winner.

129376.description:
In Indigenous people of Taiwan, players are tour guides who plan a trip around the beautiful island of Taiwan. You will also reach deep in the mountains to experience the cultural variety of different tribes. The player who manages to spend the least on travel will become the best tour guide this journey!

Indigenous people of Taiwan is both a standalone game and an expansion for Hello Taiwan! that allows for up to six players to enjoy a fruitful trip in Taiwan.

玩家扮演領隊導遊角色，帶各位來趟臺灣環島旅行，東南西北共四個方向，並且深入原住民部落，體驗原住民祭典文化。在這場旅程中花費最少的旅費的玩家將成為最專業的旅遊達人！

Integrates with


Hello! Taiwan
129376.name: Indigenous people of Taiwan

129377.name: Goal Chance
129377.description:
Goal Chance is a simple, quick-result soccer replay/simulation game which allows you to complete entire seasons very quickly and accurately with goal scorers and times of goals. Gameplay consists of rolling the dice and referring to the player/team statistics on the team set cards and the game charts to determine which team won the match.

Goal Chance can be used with the expansion team sets from the following of Terry Goodchild's other soccer games:
Full Time, Soccer Replay or Final Score

although it is a much faster and simpler than those games, mostly used to get quick match results.

It comes with a rulebook and some charts. Two 6-sided and 1 10-sided dice are also needed to play.

It can be purchased alone or with Full Time.

129378.description:
This is the brutal ground-pounding side of combat using massive forces of tanks, ground attack craft, mechanical walkers and heavily armoured infantry. This is the part of the invasion when you use your major assets to smash your enemy, this isn't about pretending you are taking a planet with 10 tanks - this is the part when you tactically deploy waves of armour to clear the way before you, pulverising any fool who stands in your way. We call this PLANETFALL and it will be presented using 10mm scale miniatures.

Source: Publisher blurb

Planetfall is a miniature tabletop wargame, set in Firestorm Armada universe. Game uses 10mm miniatures and dice to reproduce future combat during plant invasion. Planetfall if one of three game systems (second is Conquest and third Spec Ops), and focuses on big battles between tanks, and heavy mechs.

Firestorm Invasion: Planetfall is designed to be a fast and furious game of massed armored combat. The game mechanics have been kept simple and easy to learn, allowing players to quickly get to grips with the tactical use and deployment of their key military assets.

Dice are an integral part of FI:P, adding an element of chance to represent the many varied factors present on the battlegrounds of the far-future. Generally, players will be asked to roll a number of D6 and add up the total number of ‘hits’ or ‘successes’. In most circumstances each roll of 4, 5 or 6 will be a success, although various effects can cause this ‘to hit’ number to change.

Every Squadron in FI:P has an Activation Card. These cards are used to add an extra level of tactical game play. These are supplied as blank cards, so that you can mark them to distinguish between your Squadrons. Activation Cards have two purposes in the game; they are used to control a player’s Order of March and are also used to plan a player’s reserves.

Each Turn during a game of FI:P each player will have a number of Command Points. The number available is calculated at the beginning of each Turn. These are then used throughout the Turn to improve Command Tests, play Game Cards and to allow Squadrons to perform more complex actions.

Game Cards in FI:P are used to represent a wide range of unplanned events, electronic warfare systems, direct command intervention and sheer luck! They add an
additional level of tactics and learning when and how to use them brings a dynamic element to the game.

A game of FI:P consists of a number of Turns, with each Turn broken down into the following main phases:

1. Command Point Phase
2. Order of March Phase
3. Turn Card Phase
4. Initiative Phase
5. Squadron Activation Phase
6. End Phase

END OF GAME

At this point, players should check to see if the Scenario’s Victory Conditions have been satisfied by either player, if the Time or Turn Limit has expired or if the roll for Variable game length should be made. If the game has ended, then Victory Points should be calculated for both sides, depending on the Scenario played, and the winner should be determined.

The winner of a game of FI:P is normally decided by comparing Victory Point Totals after the final Turn has been played, unless a Scenario is being played that gives alternative Victory Conditions.

MULTI-PLAYER GAMES

Although it is preferable for everyone to have their own deck of Game Cards, it is possible share a deck. Each player will need to draw from a shared deck and discard to a shared Discard Pile.

Important Note: If a deck is used by more than one player, where possible, allies, rather than opponents, should use a shared deck.

You may not play cards on your allies’ models unless the card text specifically allows you to. In games with more than two players per side you may ONLY play cards to benefit models you control or to hinder enemy models.
129378.name: Firestorm Invasion: Planetfall

129379.name: Premiership Football
129379.description:
A soccer replay/simulation/management game in which dice rolls and charts are used to simulate the management and gameplay results of soccer teams.

Paraphrased from the Owzat site:

Team Squad Ratings, attack and defence are used separately, reflecting the squad strengths of the teams. These are constructed on a goals scored and conceded basis using the final league table to ensure an accurate statistical base. Individual team ratings are used for Injuries and Suspensions, for Injuries reflecting the effect of an injury to a key player of players on the Squad strength of the team, thus ensuring that the teams with smaller and less flexible squads will suffer more severely from injury absentees, for Suspensions penalising those teams that have proved over the season that they are rarely able to field a full strength side because of this reason (e.g. Arsenal, Leeds). Cash is allocated to each club, allowing the rich to enter the transfer market more freely than their less wealthy rivals, provided the right player comes along of course. Transfers in and out, injuries and suspensions are dealt with in a fairly abstract way, as is necessary in a game that is about teams and not individuals. Opportunities will arise to strengthen the Attack/ Defensive Squad Values, players may have to be sold which have the reverse affect, all without names but all having an immediate effect on team strengths and performances.

A day's fixtures, whether it be just a couple of mid-week matches or a full Saturday/Sunday programme, are valued as a complete package before any match is resolved. This involves checking for Injuries and Suspensions on a team-by-team basis and then assessing which Goal Card to use for each time by deducting one team's Defence Squad value from the opponent's Attack Squad value and rounding the result down to a figure divisible by ten. When all matches have been valued, a roll of two pairs of coloured dice per match will produce a half time score line, a second roll for each will give the full time result. Book keeping consists of marking up the result on the Results Matrix and up dating both the Cumulative Points and Goals For and Against Charts.

129380.description:
The East India Company grows quickly through the delivery of exotic goods from New World and Far East – but to operate on such a large scale, the company needs money, so the first world stock market is opened in Amsterdam. Rich citizens see the opportunity to acquire even more riches, so they invest in the stock market, while also wanting to take part in even more opportunities to make profit. Thus, much wanted exotic goods can be bought and sold, too, and with no secure routes a player can make even better profits by trading them.

In Mercurius players take on the role of rich citizens in Holland in the 17th century. They invest their money in stocks of different branches of the East India Company or try to earn much more profit through risky trade in exotic goods. Players have their own information about activities in the far lands and about events which can influence prices at the market, but each of them sees only part of the picture, so they have to look at what other players are doing and which prices are influenced by them.

Players have starting cash at the beginning of the game, along with five "changing prices" cards and four cards which allow them to take special actions during play. The game board shows prices for stocks of six branches of the East India Company and for six goods those branches trade. On a turn, a player can make up to three purchases or sales of stocks or goods as he wishes. He then plays one "changing prices" card from his hand. Each card changes the price of one stock and one good. Each card changes the prices three times, once on the turn it's played and on two consecutive turns. The tricky part is that cards move the value of goods twice as much as the value of stocks, so players can earn more by trading goods – but doing so is far more risky.

Who will become the richest citizen of Holland and win the game?
129380.name: Mercurius

129381.name: Wild Patterns
129381.description:
Wild Patterns - A game of fast perception

Wild Patterns is a family board game offering a mixture of fast perception, problem solving, and tactics.

The aim is to find patterns shown on your cards from the different colored wooden tiles constantly moving around the game board. The trickier the pattern, the more points they give. Constant changes within patterns cause sudden and surprisingly tricky situations.

You better be fast, because patterns can be scored at any time, even during other players' turn.

Keep focused, wild patterns are on the move!

Game duration is less than half an hour. The Game can be played by 2-6 players from ages 8 and up. Rules are simple and quick to comprehend.
Wild Patterns can be played as a short & easy or a long & tricky version.

---

Villit Kuviot - nopean hahmottamisen peli

Villit Kuviot on nopeaa hahmottamista, ongelmanratkaisua ja taktiikkaa yhdistävä hauska koko perheen lautapeli. Yhden pelin kesto on noin puoli tuntia ja peli sopii sekä lapsille, että aikuisille. Pelin säännöt ovat helpot ja pelin oppii välittömästi.

Pelissä yritetään laudalla olevia värillisiä puukuutioita liikuttelemalla muodostaa kädessä oleviin kortteihin merkittyjä kuvioita. Pelin voittaa pelaaja, joka saa valmiiksi eniten korttien mukaisia kuvioita.

Pelissä pelilaattojen muutokset aiheuttavat hauskoja ja yllättäviä tilanteita. Pisteitä voi jopa tehdä vastustajien pelivuorojen aikana. Nopea visuaalinen hahmottaminen on tärkeää. Peli sopii kaikenlaisille pelaajille iästä riippumatta.

Pelaaja voi valita oman pelitaktiikkansa. Rakentamalla pieniä helppoja kuvioita saa vähemmän pisteitä, mutta enemmän kuvioita valmiiksi. Rakentamalla vaikeampia isoja kuvioita, pelaaja saa enemmän pisteitä, mutta ottaa riskin, että kuviota ei saakaan valmiiksi.

Nuoremmat lapset voivat pelata peliä ilman vaikeimpia kuvioita, kun taas haastetta kaipaavat voivat jättää pelistä helpot kuviot pois. Kun kokemus kertyy voi mukaan ottaa vaikeimmat erikoiskuviokortit, jotka antavat lisähaastetta.

129382.description:
Ark & Noah – originally shown under the name Diluvium – is a game of strategy in which players must not only compete for points, but must also work together to build and load the Ark. Everyone shares the task of saving the animals, but in the end there can be only one winner!

In the game, the players are Noah and his sons, and they must find the animal couples and load them on the Ark before the Flood starts. In each round, they will choose which action they will take: Searching for Animals; Collecting Wood, Food or Pitch; Building Corrals in their color; or Loading Animals on the Ark. This choice also determines the round order for the next turn. Players score points by loading animals in the right corrals, possibly in the player's color. Thus, in each round there is a strategical phase (choose action) and a tactical phase (execute action).
129382.name: Ark & Noah

129383.name: Friform - frihet i en liten box
129383.description:
from back of box in Swedisn

I friformasboxen hittar du de fem senaste produktionerna från ASF. Samtliga scenarion är direkt spelbara, kompletta med karaktärer och rekvisita. I boxen medföljer även en guide till friformsrollspel.

freely translated to English

In the free-form box you will find the five latest productions from ASF. All scenarios are ready to play, complete with characters and props. In the box is also a guide to playing free form roleplaying games.

129384.name: Hexenkessel
129384.description:
Objective: Gain as many cards (=witches' brew) as possible
- acting by turns -
flip top 'brew' card:
active player chooses one of the ingredients (sticks) out of the witches' vessel; if it matches you may draw another (if needed); wrong? Place stick(s) back into the vessel, next players turn.
If you finished a brew: keep the card.
Drawing a spell? Turn the vessel at 180°
Game ends after all cards are gone.

129385.name: Asian Junk
129385.description:
From the Introduction:

The basic design of the junk is truly ancient, and ships of this build are just as popular with pirates and smugglers as they are with traders and fishermen. Thus it is no wonder to see ships like this one dominating the local waters. Among the many advantages of these ship type are that it can be sailed with a small crew and that, without a keel, it has a low draft.

This particular ship in addition was built with a double hull and its interior is separated into several compartments. These two design features make the ship extraordinary hard to sink. The ships draft is extraordinary low even fully loaded allowing it to sail not only on the open sea but up rivers as well. Another feature gained by the low berth is that the ship can anchor in water too shallow for other ships of its size.

And although it could be sailed with as few as a handful of crewmen it can carry a considerably larger number of men. Considering all this, it comes as no big surprise that this junk is under the command of a less than reputable captain and carries contraband or pirates more often than merchants and trade goods.

129386.name: Das große Fußball-Quiz
129386.description:
Over 1,000 tricky questions and answers about the German Bundesliga and the 2nd Bundesliga.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points or by time. Who is the first to score predetermined points or has the most points after a certain time is the winner..

129388.description:
+6 Bag o' Radioactive Munchkin d6 contains six Munchkin-head dice and four new Munchkin Apocalypse cards. Three of the dice are fluorescent green with orange pips, and three are fluorescent orange with green pips. The cards all require the use of the dice, although you could substitute regular dice if necessary.

The cards are as follows:

Classified - (Treasure) An item enhancer that gives a variable bonus based on rolling a radioactive d6.
Carpet Bomb - (Treasure) An item that gives combat bonuses to the players and monsters, based on rolling all of the radioactive d6s.
The Beast - (Door) A level 20 monster that has an additional effect based on rolling all of the radioactive d6s.
Lots of Luck! - (Door) Based on the roll of all of the radioactive d6s, either open a Seal, close a Seal, or go up a level.




Part of the Munchkin series.
129388.name: +6 Bag o' Radioactive Munchkin d6

129389.description:
This card was given to people who bought Immortal Heroes at GenCon 2012.

From the Card:

Arha Sanctuary
Cost: 3 Runes to acquire
Enlightened Construct
When this enters play put the top card of your deck under this face up. Once per turn, you may swap a card in your hand for the card under Arha Sanctuary

When Arha Sanctuary leaves play or the game ends, put the card under it into your discard pile.
129389.name: Ascension: Immortal Heroes – Arha Sanctuary Promo Card

129390.description:
"Beir & Bones" is the 3rd Game Book in a series for the worlds foremost Black Powder Fantasy game; Flintloque. Contains full rules for Character driven Section level skirmish gaming along with full background for the Kartoffelbreg theatre of the Mordredian Wars. Plus Army information for the Nations located thier.

Character creation and Section rules, magicke, skills, traits, flaws both generic and racial specific.

Also Solo play rules and much more.

Flintloque is a tabletop miniature game which takes place in a parody fantasy setting loosely based upon early 19th century Europe and the Napoleonic wars. Features many standard fantasy races such as dwarves, elves, and orcs but also has some unusual races like bunnies, otters, and rats.

Fast playing with minimal bookkeeping, it is a radical departure from previous versions of the game. It is sure to appeal to more casual gamers as well as Flintloque veterans.
129390.name: Flintloque (third edition): Bier & Bones

129393.name: Fanny
129393.description:
Fanny is a nice and helpful instructor. She tells you all about riding and horse care, how you have to hold the reins, and how you scrape the horse's hoof etc.
Players choose their horse and starts racing. In his turn player rolls the dice and draws a card collecting various stuff he needs. If he must jump over the hurdles he needs horseshoes etc. or continues his ride until he collects things he needs

Who finish the race first is the winner.

129394.name: Levee en Masse

videogamehonor.23083: 2012 Charles S. Roberts  Best Pre-20th Century Era Computer Wargame Nominee

129394.description:
Crush the Monarchy, fight for Liberty in the name of the Republic, repel foreign invaders, grab a musket, and join the Levée en Masse!

Source: The Developer Website.

129395.description:
From Hasbro website:

"It's a brand new way to play the classic property trading game! Be the first in this card game to get a million dollars in your bank pile and win MONOPOLY Millionaire Deal! Pick up cards when it's your turn and play any combination of Money, Action and Property cards. Don't hesitate to steal a property or set of properties from another player if you get the right action cards, but hang on to the Just Say No card in case someone tries to do the same to you! Build up property sets, gather piles of money and keep wheeling and dealing to make that million!
Win the MONOPOLY Millionaire Deal card game by making a million dollars! Earn and swap properties and charge other players rent! Steal properties or sets of properties from other players when you get the right Action card! Just Say No card protects you from other players' thefts!"
129395.name: Monopoly Millionaire Deal Card Game

129396.name: Farben-Flitzer
129396.description:
Great fun for two little racers.

Player rolls the color dice in his turn and it shows the color of the next space player may advance with his car.
Who finishes first is the winner.

129400.name: Kick-Off
129400.description: A simple roll and then read the results of the play, football game from the early 1940's.

129401.name: Spell Trek
129401.description:
Players are on a trek around the world, trying to take photographs of the things they see, but somehow all the vowels are missing! Complete the words by finding the missing vowels and you will move ahead on the Game Board.

Each player receives three Word Cards, and places them face up in front of them. On your turn, draw a Vowel Tile and check whether it can be added to any of your own Word Cards. If not, check whether it can be added to another player's Word Cards. If it can, and it has no prior vowels added to it, you may exchange one of your empty cards for theirs and play your Vowels Tile.

If a player completes a word, they move ahead on the Game Board as many spaces as the length of that word (3 letter words move 3 spaces, etc). The player must spell the word aloud for everyone to hear as they move their pawn on the board, then discard their used Word Cards and Vowel Tiles, and draw a new card.

The first time any player crosses either of the wooden bridges, recycle all the used Vowel Tiles from the Discard Tray back into the draw area, and rearrange them. The first player to reach the Finish space wins!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: The Vowels, Using Vowels to Spell, Word/Picture Recognition

129402.name: Mars Rover Landing
129402.description:
How hard is it to land on Mars? Test your skills! Your mission: guide NASA’s Mars rover Curiosity to its landing site safely and on target. Use your body to direct the craft and control thrusters as you descend. Gain avatar gear and achievements for a safe landing. The rover’s success depends on you! The Games on Demand version supports English, French, Italian, German, Spanish, Danish, Dutch, Finnish, Greek, Hungarian, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Swedish, Japanese, Korean, Chinese. This game requires a Kinect™ Sensor.

Source: The Publisher Website.

129403.description:
From back cover:
The 4th Expansion for the Unique RPG/Boardgame of Starship Adventure: Battlestations TM

The Galaxy is at your feet! (wheels, flippers, jets, or whatever motility appendages you deploy).

This book details over 50 planets with challenges and opportunities abounding.

A Galactic Map
8 New Species (Blootian Bubbloids, Chronosian Timehoppers, Double-acting Diploids, Friendly Kerbites, Tiny Minutians, Pyreltian Phasoids, Tentacled Vomegs and Mighty Whaleoids)
New Special Abilities (Fume Runner, Rammer, Weapons Officer, Smuggler and more!)
22 New Missions

A complete campaign system for operating as Free Traders.
129403.name: Battlestations: How Much For Your Planet?

129404.name: Firestorm Invasion: Conquest
129404.description:
Once you've smashed your enemy with a lightning strike, it's time to take, and then hold, those vital enemy hotspots. This could be fighting over a military base, entering the ruins of a devastated city, or some other strategic objective. This is where your highly trained infantry, with armoured support, come into their own. We call this CONQUEST and it will be presented using 15mm scale miniatures.

Source: Publisher Blurb

Conquest is second tabletop wargame in Firestorm Invasion family. This game uses 15mm and dice to recreate fights during planet invasion in Firestorm Armada universe.

Each player controls his forces made of 15mm infantry and vehicles and tries to decimate opponent or fulfil scenario objective.

129405.name: Firestorm Invasion: Special Ops
129405.description:
Lastly, but by no means least, comes the gritty art of daring special operations. Small teams of highly trained troops going man-to-man against the best your enemy can throw at you. Capture a bunker, rescue hostages, eliminate a target or destroy a shield generator - this is what your elite troops trained for. We call this SPECIAL OPS and it will be presented using 28mm scale miniatures.

Source: Publisher blurb

Special Ops is third, and final tabletop wargame in Firestorm Invasion family. It uses dice and 28mm to recreate small scale special operations during final phase of planet invasion in Firestorm Armada universe.

Each player control small force made from 28mm miniatures and tries to fulfil scenario objective or smash his opponent.

129406.name: Vous êtes Napoléon
129406.description:
user summary

You are Napoléon!
Through your choices, you can become the most powerful leader of Europe... or just rise to fall harder.

129407.name: Vous êtes Kennedy
129407.description:
user summary

You are Kennedy!
Through your choices, you can become the President of the USA and change the world.

129408.name: Vous êtes de Gaulle
129408.description:
user summary

You are de Gaulle!
Through your choices, you can become the leader of the French Resistance during WWII and later President of France.

129409.name: Save the Animals
129409.description: Race around the board to get your animals to the safety of the reserve, but be careful to avoid the hazards as you go. Will help build awareness of animal conservation. Each player takes a turn throwing their dice and moves one of their animals the appropriate number of spaces. When you land on a space, follow the instructions written on the space. The first player to get all their family of animals to safety is the winner.

129410.name: Teddy's Party
129410.description:
Childrens card game. There are eight full sets of different Teddy cards. A set consists of five cards, a full-size Teddy and four other cards, each a quarter of the related Teddy.

Deal 7 cards to each player. The first player must play a full size Teddy card if he has one. If he doesn't, he draws a card. Once a full size Teddy card is on the table, the next player can play either another full size Teddy card or can add a quarter card to any matching Teddy currently on the table. You must play a card if you can but you may only ever play one card per turn.

When a set is finished, the player playing the last quarter card on it, scores 1 point. The first player to use all their cards scores 5 points. The winner is the first player to score 11 points.

129411.name: Une poule sur un mur…
129411.description:
A single pawn travels on a wall the number of spaces indicated by the dice, but in the direction chosen by the player. The space where the hen stops indicates what action is possible to do - draw, give, receive or exchange card etc.
The goal is to collect five cards that make up the rhyme.

129412.name: Melzindar
129412.description:
From the back of the book:

Als während des Kriegs der Magier die Königsfeste Tumunzahar unter dem Ansturm der Orcs fiel, gingen nicht nur zahllose Leben, sondern auch unwiederbringliche Schätze des Zwergenvolkes verloren. Einer davon war ein legendäres Artefakt aus grauer Vorzeit, der Melzindar, ein Feuerbock, dessen heiliges Feuer Wunder wirken konnte. Jetzt gibt es Mächte, die das Königsfeuer dem Vergessen entreißen möchten, und sie brauchen sterbliche Helfer ...

Das Abenteuer beginnt in einem Gasthaus im nördlichen Artross-Gebirge, an dem ein von den Zwergen genutzter Gebirgspfad entlang führt. Die Gefährten werden Zeuge, wie die Wirtstochter wie in Trance uralte Verse über den Melzindar vorträgt, die einer ihrer Vorfahren, ein Überlebender des Falls von Tumunzahar, geschmiedet hatte. Sie verlangt das Königsfeuer als Brautpreis von ihrem Bräutigam, der alles andere als ein heldenhafter Abenteurer ist und all seinen Mut und natürlich erfahrene Helfer braucht, um sich dieser Herausforderung des Schicksals zu stellen.

Die Verse liefern einen Hinweis, dass das Artefakt in einem seit einem tragischen Unglück verlassenen Bergwerk verborgen ist. Nach einer Reise durch albisches Zwergenland und darüber hinaus müssen die Gefährten sich in dieser verlassenen Mine mit den Geister der verunglückten Bergleute, mit der Naturmagie des Berges, aber auch mit finsteren Schattenzwergen auseinandersetzen, bis sie endlich das Königsfeuer in Händen halten. Damit ist die Geschichte aber noch nicht am Ende, denn auf dem Rückweg geraten die Abenteurer in einen Aufmarsch der Orcs der Nebelberge und müssen feststellen, dass sich nicht nur deren geheimnisumwitterter Herr, sondern auch ein Halbgott und ein Schatten der Nacht für den Melzindar interessieren.

Dieses Heft enthält ein Rollenspiel-Abenteuer, das Spielerfiguren mittleren Grades mit der Lebensart der Zwerge Albas vertraut macht und kämpferische wie rollenspielerische Fähigkeiten gleichermaßen fordert.


Translation:

When during the War of the Magi the Kings Stronghold Tumunzahar fell before the onslaught of Orcs, lost were not only countless lives but also irreplaceable treasures of the dwarven people. One of them was a legendary artifact from ancient times, the Melzindar a firedog, whose sacred fire could work wonders. Now there are forces that want to snatch the kings fire from oblivion, and they need mortal helpers ...

The adventure begins in a guesthouse in the northern Artross Mountains, where a hiking trail used by the dwarves leads along. The Fellowship will witness as the innkeeper's daughter in a trance recites ancient verses about Melzindar, one of her ancestors, a survivor of the fall of Tumunzahar had made. She demands the kings fire as a bride price from her fiancé, who is anything but a heroic adventurer and who needs all his courage and of course experienced helpers to rise to this challenge of fate.

The verses provide an indication that the artifact is hidden in an mine abandoned since a tragic accident. After a trip through the lands of the albian dwarves and beyond, in the abandoned mine the companions have to deal with the spirits of the injured miners, with the natural magic of the mountain, but also with dark shadow dwarves until they finally hold the kings fire in their hands. But the story is not finished yet, because on the way back, the adventurers get into a parade of the Orcs of the Misty Mountains, and have to find out that not only the mysterious leader of the Orcs, but also a demigod, and a shadow of the night are interested in the Melzindar.

This booklet provides a role-playing adventure for player characters of intermediate levels that makes familiar with the lifestyle of the dwarves of Alba and calls for combative and role-playing skills equally.

129413.description:
Released at GenCon 2012, The Battle of Lake-town is second print-on-demand encounter deck (so, not a full expansion like the monthly decks).

Description from Fantasy Flight:
"Believed to be nothing but a legend by the younger generation of men who live in Lake-town, Smaug the Dragon descends from the Lonely Mountain unlooked for in the dead of night. The Dragon believes the people of Lake-town are responsible for the recent theft of his treasure, but the people of Lake-town know nothing of this. All they know is that if they don't stop him, Smaug will destroy their homes. Now the heroes must face the Dragon's wrath to save Lake-town from burning..."
129413.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Battle of Lake-town

77423.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game

129415.name: Elder Sign: The Hand of Solace – Promotional Adventure Card
129415.description:
The Hand of Solace is a mail order card from Fantasy Flight Games. The card can only be acquired by using the order form in the back of the novel The Lies of Solace published by FFG.

The card provides a new location for Elder Sign based on the novel.

129416.name: Pétanque de table
129416.description:
Pentanque on the table.

There are discs instead of balls and players throw them as close as possible to jack. Player (or team) who has his ball closer to jack is the winner.

129417.name: Scotland Yard
129417.description:
Rules
Preparation
24 figures emerge from the cards were punched and placed a plastic foot each.
The head of Scotland Yard receives twelve policemen, six numbered top secret folders, the secret plans and 3 tokens of admiration. The other player, leader of a gang of international espionage, gets 12 characters with their dossiers for the 3 and 9 spy chips chips admiring.

Strategy.

Place both players back. The head of Scotland Yard takes 6 folders of buildings and hidden secrets 3 planes, in other places chips admiring. The spy chief decides that three characters are spies and what not, well placed spy tabs in the dossiers of the characters chosen, the other will be a token of admiration.

Gameplay.

In turn each player spins the wheel and cautro ahead of his figures both indicate as many squares as roulette, the police begin to Trafalgar Square, blue box, the characters of either red squares.
The characters and police advance or recede but not in the same play is each shape or forward or backward.

Indications of roulette.

There are three different symbols, a figure, to move, a glove and a whistle.
The figure serves to move the glove indicated that a single policeman and advance the next roll out as many squares as if the police with that movement stands with a character that will be required to identify themselves. If a whistle out the next roll will be double the result.

129418.name: Bacchanalia
129418.description:
Bacchanalia is a narrative game for 3-6 people. Following the rules, each player creates a fictional character – a person accused (justly or not) of a crime against the empire and on the run with her lover. The game starts when the protagonists find themselves passing through Bertinoro, a settlement on the hills of Romagna by the Via Aemilia and close to the Ravenna port.

Unfortunately for them, in that torrid summer, Bacchus and his followers came down to this village surrounded by vineyards. Attracted by the excesses brought forth by intoxication, other gods manifest themselves; cruel Pluto, severe Minerva and the sensuous Venus will play with the destiny of mortals with all the thoughtlessness only gods can have. The player's objective is to reunite with her beloved and run away. Each player in turn draws a hand of cards and, based on the results of the draw, describes a scene from the story for her protagonists. Elements of the scene vary according to which god was more present in the draw. For instance, a scene dominated by Pluto will feature a violent crime in which the protagonist ends up somehow involved. Benevolent Venus reunites lovers. Bacchus brings thrill and excitement, and so on. There is a clear winning condition – reuniting with the beloved and running away before your accuser catches you – but one player reaching it doesn't prevent other players from doing the same; multiple winners are possible.

In the chaos of the bacchanal, will the fugitives be able to reunite with their beloved and get to safety? Or will they meet a harsher end? Will they be caught by their accuser – or will they be lost forever in the rapture of the bacchanal?

129419.name: Ice Age 3: Das Scrat-Spiel
129419.description: Brrr! Scrat shivers on the ice floe. While holding his precious nut, he throws ice cubes from the ice floe. Whoever grabs all the ice-pieces of his color fastest wins the game. All wrong cubes must be put back.

129420.name: Legion
129420.description:
From the packaging:

"An addictive game of strategy versus risk for any number of players. Roll the dice and build your score... but learn to judge when to stop!"

The game comes in a plastic blister pack. It contains a "velveteen" dice pouch, six dice with roman numerals, a black-and-white rule book with historical notes, and a black-and-white score pad.

A turn consists of the player rolling all six dice. If he scores any points, according to a list of scoring combinations (e.g. three "D"s score 500 points), he may then set aside these and roll again, getting the chance to accumulate more points. Alternatively, he can stop rolling and keep his accumulated score. If he rolls a no-scoring throw, then he scores zero for that turn, even if he had set aside scoring dice from previous rolls. His points are then recorded, and play passes on to the next player. The game ends when someone scores 5000 points; everyone else "with a turn left" then gets a chance to better this player's score.

The historical notes claim that this is a real ancient Roman game, originating from the late republic.

As of writing, this game is being sold in museum shops in the UK, at historic sites related to ancient Rome (e.g. sites on Hadrian's Wall).

129421.description:
The official Paris expansion for On The Underground.

This expansion consists of a files providing a new map and station cards for On The Underground, as well as rules document describing the differences to the base On The Underground game required to play it.
129421.name: On the Underground: Paris

129422.name: Beyond Good and Evil 2
129422.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




Beyond Good & Evil 2 will be in continuity with the first game, with a big variety of levels, lots of emotion in the gameplay, and characters we care about. This time we are dealing with planet's future, and the relationship with the animals.

Source: Wikipedia, "Beyond Good & Evil 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

176443.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Dark Elements

129423.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) - Lair of the Wyrm introduces five new quests that can be played individually or used to supplement a larger campaign. With inventive objectives like rescuing survivors from a burning inn and protecting valuable ore from a greedy ettin, the Quest Guide in Lair of the Wyrm delivers fresh new challenges to your adventures.

What's more, Lair of the Wyrm brings two new heroes to the fight against the forces of evil. Reynhart the Worthy is a fearless warrior whose prowess in combat means he rarely makes mistakes. He can reroll misses once per attack, helping to ensure that every strike is righteous and true. Meanwhile, High Mage Quellen is a master of body and mind, and is able to quickly recover from exertions that would devastate lesser men. Quellen has developed the ability to feed off the fatigue of those around him, gaining strength where his fellows fail.

But even as the heroes of Terrinoth gain new allies and tactics, their great enemy silently grows in sinister power. In addition to the Wyrm Queen herself, a fearsome Dragon Lord lieutenant seemingly formed from solidified flame, the Overlord gains two new monsters: mischievous and destructive Fire Imps, and flying Hybrid Sentinels...half-dragon monstrosities with a cruel penchant for preying on the weak. The Overlord's new advantages are not limited to his minions, however. His new available class, Punisher, specializes in making heroes pay for every inch they advance. With abilities like Trading Pains and Exploit Weakness, the Punisher class will make the hero players flinch with fear every time something seems to go their way.
129423.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Lair of the Wyrm

129424.name: Banzai Blade
129424.description:
Banzai Blade is an exciting run-and-slash action game inspired by the super-natural feats accomplished by the heroes in traditional Chinese Wuxia movies. Banzai Blade is one of the few games out there that combines slash movements in a totally 3D rail environment. In Banzai Blade, you are a fearless Shinobi (ninja) with only one goal: you must bring back peace to the land of Nihon! Use your ninjutsu techniques to thwart the evil Dark Oni, who will stop at nothing to fulfill his dreams of complete domination over Nihon. Stop him—before it’s too late!

Source: The Developer Website.

129425.name: Catapult King
129425.description:
A simple fairy tale story becomes something much greater in this fantastic new physics puzzler. Pull back on the catapult and attempt to destroy the enemy-riddled forts with accurately placed shots, and go for the win. Nothing is more gratifying than saving the gorgeous princess, right? Of course not.

Source: The Publisher Website.

129426.name: Unstoppable Fist
129426.description:
Have you been stockpiling cheetos in preparation for the end of the world? All signs point to apocalypse. That is unless a hero takes a stand to save the free world. Could you be the Unstoppable one spoken of in legend? Here's your chance to find out!

Unstoppable Fist, THE action game of 2012 has arrived! Play as Fist, a hero called from beyond the stars who has come to Earth to answer our desperate cry for help. Survive as long as you can against never ending waves of evil monsters.

Deliver powerful blows with your Loafers of Light and Unstoppable Fists to defeat your enemies. Tap at one of six onscreen touch zones to deliver your attacks to HI, MID, and LOW levels. Beware, each enemy type has a different attack that will test even the most skilled player!

Source: The Developer Website.

129427.name: Shark Dash
129427.description:
Sharkee and his merry band of toy sharks were living happily in the bathtub. That is, until a bunch of mischievous ducks came along to ruin their peaceful little world. When the ducks kidnap Sally, Sharkee’s girlfriend, that’s when Sharkee and his buds have had enough! Join a wild journey to tricky bathtubs around the world, save Sally and get rid of the dimwitted ducks!

Source: The Developer Website.

129429.name: Men In Black 3
129429.description:
For the first time ever, you can be the boss of your own MIB agency.
Create and manage your organization, meet dozens of aliens and take down intergalactic enemies with your agents and high-tech weapons.
In the field you’ll become a young agent, who, with the help of Agent O, Agent K and Frank, will fight against a new threat to humanity lead by the vile Radiant.
Not only will you interact with many faithfully recreated characters and aliens from the Men in Black universe, but you will also have access to special gadgets and weapons like the Neuralyzer, the infamous Noisy Cricket, and more.

Source: The Developer Website.

129430.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Conceived by General Dodonna, the RZ-1 A-wing interceptor proved its worth by crippling Star Destroyers during the Battle of Endor. Now this highly maneuverable starfighter adds another exciting dimension to Rebel squadrons. The Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game - A-Wing Expansion Pack introduces one A-wing miniature with four pilots and five upgrades. Only the most talented pilots belong in an A-wing cockpit as they push the starfighter's limits in the galaxy's deadliest dogfights!
129430.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – A-Wing Expansion Pack

129431.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Imperial players can add a lethal starfighter to their X-Wing squadrons with the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game - TIE Interceptor Expansion Pack. The finest mass-produced starfighter of its time, the TIE Interceptor excels at dogfighting thanks to its heightened maneuverability, increased speed, and four wing-mounted laser cannons. With its detailed miniature, two upgrades, and six skillful new pilots that include the renowned Soontir Fel, the TIE Interceptor Expansion Pack creates exciting opportunities for all Imperial X-Wing players!
129431.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Interceptor Expansion Pack

boardgamehonor.24515: 2013 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

129432.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Fly the legendary Millennium Falcon into fast-paced battles for the fate of the galaxy! The Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game - Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack allows players to blast through hyperspace with Han, Chewie, Lando, and more. The Millennium Falcon comes with four pilot cards, fourteen upgrades, and all requisite tokens. New rules expand the X-Wing galaxy to include large ships and modifications. With its pilots, upgrades, and lovingly detailed miniature, the Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack is a beautiful addition to the X-Wing game!
129432.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack

129433.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Originally intended as a prisoner transport, the Firespray-31 gained notoriety through association with some of the galaxy's most fearsome pirates and bounty hunters, including the infamous Boba Fett. The Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game - Slave I Expansion Pack allows players to take advantage of the Firespray's versatile armament and heavy armor plating, as well as a host of deadly new upgrades. Slave I comes with a detailed miniature, four pilot cards, thirteen upgrades, and all requisite tokens. New rules and a new mission further expand your games of X-Wing!
129433.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Slave I Expansion Pack

129434.name: Silent Hill: Defeated
129434.description:
This is an unofficial fan-made game, and is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Konami or Great Eastern Entertainment.

From the publisher:
Silent Hill: Defeated is a free, unofficial, print-and-play card game designed for use with Silent Hill-themed playing cards (not included) to play a game more thematically linked to the popular survival-horror videogame. The card deck is a "poker" deck with 2 Jokers, but the splitting of the deck's artwork between Monsters (Black suits) and Heroes (Red suits) led to the design of Silent Hill: Defeated. The game could conceivably be played with any "poker"-style deck, but the Silent Hill deck from Great Eastern Entertainment is highly recommended.

The gameplay is like Silent Hill meets Uno. You start the game by drawing 7 cards and your goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand. You do this by "challenging" the top card of the discard pile. Sometimes that card is a Monster and you will need a Hero to fight it. Sometimes, it's the other way around. The Heroes (red-suited cards) and Monsters (black-suited cards) have different rules and play a little differently, but in the end you have to combine both strategies in order to empty your hand of cards, which allows you to finally escape the twisted place called... Silent Hill.
(please check the Files section for the rules pdf.)

129435.name: Sound Domino
129435.description:
Children's picture dominoes game but with a real twist - with sound! Besides the 28 domino cards, you have Marvin the Electronic Mouse.

There are seven types of images, Ship, Bicycle, Motorbike, Tractor, Car, Train and Aeroplane. Marvin has sound effects to go with each image.

Each player gets a number of dominoes depending on the number of players. These are laid out in front of you picture-side up. One domino is also placed in the centre of the table. Marvin must be in easy reach of all the players.

In your turn you must press Marvin's button and he will play a sound (example - ring-a-ding). Now, everyone looks at their dominoes at the same time, looking for a bicycle domino that will fit to the array of dominoes in the centre (of course, normal domino rules apply). If you have a domino that will fit at either end of the array, you must quickly press the blue button on Marvin. Play continues until someone uses all their dominoes and that person is the winner.

129436.name: Baa Baa Black Sheep
129436.description:
Children's card game based on the nursery rhyme:

Baa Baa Black Sheep, have you any wool?
Yes sir, yes sir, three bags full
One for my master, one for my dame
and one for the little boy who lives down the lane

The rules:
Object To collect a set of 4 cards comprising of a Little Boy, a Dame, a Master and a Black Sheep.
Deal each player four cards and place the rest of the pile face downwards on the table. Turn the top card over and place face upwards beside the pile. All the players look at the 4 cards in their hand to see if they already have a Dame, A Black Sheep, Little Boy or Master card amongst them.The youngest player begins by taking a card from the top of the pile. If this card is a Dame, Master or Little Boy card he can keep it to add or start his collection. He will then place an unwanted card from his hand on the pile which is face upwards beside the main pile. If he has picked up a Black Sheep card, or if he has a Black Sheep card already in his hand, he may place the Black Sheep card face upwards on the pile and turn to any player saying ‘Have you any wool?’ If the person questioned has a Dame, Master or Little Boy card in his hand he must hand this card over in return for whatever card the original player chooses to give him. The player who has asked ‘Have you any wool?' then takes another card from the main pile to keep a total of four cards in his hand.
Play then continues with the next player taking another card from the pile. If he picks up a Dame, Master or Little Boy card he can add or start his collection and must throw away any unwanted card from his hand on to the pile face upwards. A Black Sheep card may not be picked up from the face up pile, but any other card can be taken. Play continues with each player taking a turn in the same manner.
The winner is the first player to have a Master, a Dame, a Little Boy and a Black Sheep card in his hand.

boardgameimplementation.195571: Legendary Encounters: A Firefly Deck Building Game

boardgameintegration.156689: Legendary: Villains – A Marvel Deck Building Game

boardgamehonor.24513: 2013 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee

129437.description:
Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game is set in the Marvel Comics universe. To set up the game, players choose a mastermind villain (Magneto, Loki, Dr. Doom, etc.), stack that particular villain's attack cards underneath it, then modify the villain deck as needed based on that villain's particular scheme. Players then choose a number of hero decks – Spider-Man, Hulk, Cyclops, Wolverine, etc. – and shuffle them together; since players use only a handful of hero decks out of the fifteen included, the hero deck can vary widely in terms of what's available.

Over the course of the game, players will recruit powerful hero cards to add to their deck in order to build a stronger and more resourceful deck. Players need to build both their recruitment powers (to enlist more heroes) and their fighting ability (to combat the villains who keep popping up to cause trouble). Players recruit heroes from an array of five cards, with empty slots refilled as needed. At the start of a player's turn, he reveals a villain and adds it to the row of villains. This row has a limited number of spaces, and if it fills up, the earliest villain to arrive escapes, possibly punishing the heroes in some way. Some villains also take an action when showing up for the first time, such as kidnapping an innocent bystander. The villain deck also contains "master strike" cards, and whenever one of these shows up, the mastermind villain (controlled by the game) takes a bonus action.

As players fight and defeat villains, they collect those cards, which will be worth points at game's end. Players can also fight the mastermind; if a player has enough fighting power, he claims one of the attack cards beneath the mastermind, which has a particular effect on the game. If all of these cards are claimed, the game ends and players tally their points to see who wins. If the mastermind completes his scheme, however – having a certain number of villains escape, for example, or imposing a certain number of wounds on the heroes – then the players all lose.
129437.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game

boardgameaccessory.157107: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Playmat

129438.name: The Old Woman Who Lived in a Shoe
129438.description:
Childrens card game based on the nursery rhyme.

Object is to collect 10 cards comprising of The Old Woman and her nine children.

To play, spread all the cards face downwards on the floor or table. The youngest player begins by turning over one card face upwards. If the card is the Old Woman the player may place this card in front of him. He may then turn over another card to try to get the next card in sequence. When he fails he must leave the card face upwards on the table. The next player turns one card upwards and must also have the Old Woman card to start. The player may choose any of the cards on the table or floor whether these are face up or face down.
When a player has his Old Woman card in front of him, on his next turn he must try to look for a card showing a picture of a little baby. Next time he must find a picture of a child card that is slightly larger in size. To do this he can turn over another card or choose from the cards already on show. He must start with his Old Woman Card, then the little baby and then a slightly larger child until he has 10 cards in front of him. Each card will match up if chosen correctly as part of the picture overlaps from one card to another.

To finish, the winner is the first player to have the Old Woman and all her children in the correct sequence {A total of 10 cards). With two players, two sets of Old Woman and her children may be collected by each player to decide the winner {a total of 20 cards).

129439.name: Pinza De Ropa
129439.description:
UNRELEASED GAME



This game is scheduled to be released at Spiel 2013




Note that all details for this game are preliminary.

In an apartment building, the tenants are having a laundry day. Their task is simple: to hang clothes on the balconies. But, the air and shaky hands might cause some of the clothespins, pinza de ropa in Spanish, to fall, or mysteriously end up on a higher floor of the building!

The players alternate turns during which they try to have as many clothespins as possible on their floor. Each player's floor is designated by a secret objective card (marked with a star).

During their turn players choose a floor on the board, roll the dice, and then may play cards to affect the outcome of the dice. Each number on the dice different from the player's floor means that a clothespin must go to another floor. A special objective card indicates which floor is best for that player's clothespins. The winner of the game is the one that gathers the most points, based on the special objective card and a player's played cards during the duration of the game.

The print & play version which will be available through this site and the publisher's page is the family version of the game. A future version of Pinza de Ropa will include a new advanced version, with more cards, strategies, and surprises that will make the game even better!

The only thing not provided in the print'n play version of the game are the 5 dice. You will need 5 6-sided dice to play. Also, if you wish, you may use real clothespins. We have provided a .pdf with a printable clothespin, but if you want to pimp out the game...

129440.name: Memo Extra Kiekeboe
129440.description:
Can you guess what lies under the colored cards? Roll the dice and take a peek under the card of the color indicated by the
dice.

There are 24 cards in six colors and six cards with little hole in the center. In his turn player rolls the dice and try to guess the top cards of that color. If it is correct he takes that card and continues his turn. If it is wrong he must say what he saw.

If there are no more cards left, the player with the most cards wins.

129441.name: Memo Extra: My Aunt takes a journey
129441.description:
There are 48 cards with various pictures.
Shuffle the cards and distribute them to the players.
In his turn player draws the top card, look at it and says what his aunt carries for her journey.
e.g. if the card shows mattress player says: "My aunt is on a trip and carries the mattress"
The next player draws the top card from his deck and says same sentence as last player and adds the detail from his card, so that the list of things the aunt carries goes longer and longer.
Player who make a mistake is eliminated from the game.
The last player left is the winner.

129442.name: Quick Picks Password & Password Junior
129442.description:
As in the family version of Password Card Game, teams of two compete to see who can guess the secret password first. What one-word clue could get your partner to respond with the password? But you've got to be clever when you communicate because players can give only one-word clues, your opponents can hear the clues, and the fewer clues given the higher the score. The Junior version uses simpler words. The team that guesses the most words with the fewest clues wins.

originally seen in Endless Games 2008 catalog for which was never released.

129443.name: Dierenvrienden
129443.description:
Dierenvrienden (Animal Friends)

Encouragement and experimenting is what matters. Your child's selfconfidence will grow while playing together. By answering questions about animals, drawing animals or mimicing animal behaviour correctly players score points and progress on a scoringpath. In the end one of the participants will reach the finish first and can claim victory.

With questions in 3 categories, children learn a lot about the animals around them and build beautiful animals themselves.

This is not a standard game as winning is not the goal, but the game-play progresses until one person passes the end of the scoring track first.


Dierenvrienden is geen standaard bordspel: in dit bordspel draait het namelijk niet om winnen, maar om proberen. Het aanmoedigen van uw kind en de ontwikkeling staan centraal. U zult zien dat het zelfvertrouwen van uw kind door Dierenvrienden spelenderwijs zal groeien.
Door vragen te beantwoorden over dieren, dieren te tekenen of dieren na te doen worden punten verzameld. Diegene die als eerste het eindpunt bereikt mag zichzelf de winnaar noemen.

Kinderen krijgen vragen in 3 categorieën, leren zo alles over het dierenrijk en maken zelf de mooiste dieren.

129444.name: Memo Extra Picturebook Boys
129444.description: Each player chooses a story. Shuffle the 32 cards and place them face down on the table. The oldest player begins the game by looking one of the cards. If the card is part of his story player takes it and puts it in his book of images. The player may continue his turn until he looks the card not belonging to his story. He shows the card to other and ends his turn. The first player who completed his picture with 8 cards is the winner.

129445.name: Memo Extra: Slide & find

boardgameversion.206293: German "Die Sendung mit dem Elefanten" edition

129445.description:
There are 16 memory tiles and 15 slide-tiles in this game.
In start shuffle tiles separately and lay slide-tiles on the table. Then draw a top memory tile and roll the dice. Dice shows how many times You may swap the slide-tiles to find the picture of the memory tile. If You are successful You get the card as a point You may continue Your turn.

If memory-tile deck is exhausted the game is over and the player with the most cards wins.

129446.name: Memo Extra: Treasure Hunt
129446.description:
The object of the game is to be the first pirate who reached the island.

In his turn player flips 2 cards on the table. If they are not identical his turn is over. If they are identical the player:
1) moves his pawn the number of spaces indicated on the cards.
2) turns the cards face-down and places one card on any free ghost-ship.
If all 4 ghost-ships are blocked then player may add a card if he remember the last cards on this ghost-ship. If not he places the card back on the table and ends his turn.

Player who places the last card on the ghost-ship reaches first to the treasure island and is the winner

129447.name: Memo Extra Trio
129447.description:
In this memory variant, players must find 3 cards that form the combination (f.e: Pirate, Pirate Ship, Treasure)
In his turn player turns around 3 tiles and if he finds a trio, he takes the tiles and continues his turn.
Game ends if all tiles are taken.
The player with the most trios is the winner.

129448.name: The Old Guard
129448.description:
User summary:

The Old Guard is a free adventure for Battleforce Bravo.

The characters are in a firefight with Italian soldiers when they encounter the ghosts of Roman Legionnaires.

129449.name: 30 Things Can Happen!
129449.description:
From the product page:

Never be at a loss again with these thirty tables of random Medieval Fantasy events and findings in urban, rural, and underground locations. Each thirty entry table is divided into three ten entry categories, some with additional sub-options, making for nearly one thousand random results including the fun and fantastical. Use these pages to help flesh out locations during prep or to perk up a flagging game session. This invaluable resource is system-free and ready to help with any fantasy roleplaying game.

From the Introduction:

A brief word before the content, please. With this book, you can use a 30-sided die to generate a random events in many environments. Each table is further divided into three tailored categories, so you can also use a 10-sided die or a 20-sided die to make use of only one or two of the categories. Additionally, you’ll want to have a six-sided die on hand as some options even have three sub-options. As with all things random, if a result doesn’t fit, roll again or choose from those available. Where an option states man or woman, male or female, it need not be human. GMs are encouraged to be flexible when trying to implement a result. So, grab some dice and let’s get rolling!

129451.name: Digest-o-rama The Game
129451.description:
Digest-o-rama is a fun, fast paced board game that takes students on an educational journey through the Digestive System in the human body. Be the player to collect the most Digest-o-Bucks as you travel from the esophagus to the rectum. Great for 2-5 players.

Educational roll and move game with questions (similar to Trivial Pursuits) but firmly focused on the Digestive System. For 2-5 players.

129452.description:
Objective: Move from your East Frisian island up to the mainland collecting 5 ingredients (preparing tea)
and get back again
- acting by turns -
each player gets an island, the 'Alte Fritz' - a neutral figure - is placed in Aurich.
active player rolls the die - you need a 'joker' stepping from island to mainland; successful?
move vertical or horizontal if possible into cities, but do not step upon 'Alter Fritz', because he'll send you to the jail (smuggler). Get these ingredients during your stay; outside you can be challenged by other players (rock, paper, scissors) to win/loose an ingredient or you may make a deal findind the one you were searching for.
Moving back to your island you must roll a 'joker'.
remarks:
Production: Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion
129452.name: Das Ostfriesische Teespiel

129453.name: Have a Go!
129453.description:
British card game from the 1950's. The cards all feature famous people and are extremely weird. Then you realise they are photographs taken at Madame Tussauds of some of their waxwork figures.

Rules
1. Each player contributes one unit into a kitty.
2.The dealer deals the players seven cards each, then places the remainder of the pack face down in the middle.
3.Each player in turn takes a card from the top of the pack and discards one unwanted card from his hand, laying it down face up by the pack.

The first player who collects either
(a) two runs,
(b) a run and three or four of a kind,
(c) two sets of three and four of a kind,
(d) a complete run,
and lays them face up on the table, wins, and receives one unit from each player.
The first player who collects the cards “HAVE A GO” and lays them face up on the table takes the kitty and collects two units from each player.
4. A run can only consist of cards of the same colour, e.g. brown CDE or brown CDEF.
5. If a player wins by completing a run of all cards in his hand, as in rule 3 (d), then each player pays him two units.
6. The card which has been discarded by the last player can only be picked up by the next player if it enables him to finish, otherwise he must take one from the top of the pack.
7. When all cards in the pack have been picked by the players and no player has yet won, the pack of discarded cards are shuffled and stacked face down, play proceeding as before.

129454.description:
"Humans thought they were alone in the universe.
They were right!"

Timestreams takes place in a possible future, where the human race has made two very intriguing discoveries: 1) We are alone in our universe. 2) There are universes in which other races exist and function in a totally different time frame than ours. The problem is that now that we know, the other races know as well. Thus, the beginning of the timestreams invasion is now taking place, during which entire races invade the parallel timestreams. These invasions cause temporal distortions, causing a dimensional vortex that may cause one race or more to be so distorted that it will be impossible to interact with anything from a three dimensional universe.

Timestreams is a game where players alternate turns and try to wreak havoc for their opponents. All players start with their player card next to a timestream, and during the game they try to avoid being in the same timestream with another players.

Sometimes, a player must calculate a temporal distortion, and all players that are on the same timestream as another must lose an amount of this distortion by counting on their vortex resonator. The winner is the last race standing, after everyone else's race has reached its critical point. There is no player elimination. Players will continue to play until the end of the game and take their vengeance on the opponents that took them out.
129454.name: Timestreams

129455.description:
Objective: find out which 4 animals/persons (out of 12) are potential subject of a crime
- acting simultaneously -
offender = game master (changes per round) takes 4 (out of 12) hidden cards;
active player rolls the die & turns as many of (correspondent) detective cards; game master responds with correct answer;
e.g.: player rolls a '5' & draws 5 detective cards - if 2 of them are matching result becomes '2' (similar to Mastermind).
After 8 turns players must judge; each matching 'hit' let players move up their scoring position, a mismatch moves the black offender's one; new round...
at the end: top position wins;
if black offender's position is top - all lost.
129455.name: Die drei ??? Kids: Panik im Paradies

129458.name: Stellar Reaches (Issue 18 - Summer 2012)
129458.description:
Cover Art: This is an image of the White Lady, an extremely iconic image of the Kikhushegi religion. (Equivalents include the Sitting Buddha, the Virgin Mary, and Kali of the many arms.) The graphic is titled “Nightmare” © Artur Rosa.

From the Contents page:


Letter From The Editor
BITS Task System
A Gazetteer to the Worlds of the Empty Quarter
The Empty Quarter Timeline
A Glossary for the Empty Quarter
Polite and Bloody Wolves
Tribe vs. Tribe in the Empty Quarter
Population Shifts in the Empty Quarter, 993-1105
The Assassination of Archduke Gvueneghz
Soldiery in the Empty Quarter
The Christianity of the Not-That-Far Future

144452.name: Duel of Ages II: Collector's Bundle

129459.description:
Duel of Ages II is a time-scramble board game played between two opposing sides each having 1 to 4 players, with uneven size allowable. Each side controls a selected team of 8-12 characters from different ages of time: Ancient, Colonial, Modern and Future. The goal is to win greater glory in overcoming adventures and in tactical combat than the opposing team.

Although multiple styles of play are available, the standard DoA game-play involves seven phases:


Selection of each side’s team of 8-12 characters (kept secret).
Building of the interlocking puzzle map to best suit your character’s skills.
Selection of a Team White and a Team Black based on character Respect.
Revealing and equipping of characters.
Bringing characters onto the map based on Respect.
A sequence of game rounds where characters maneuver on the map to accomplish adventures, hunt enemy characters and avoid dangerous situations.
Counting of total achievements won. The team with the most achievements wins.


The game can end at a certain time or after a certain number of rounds.

Game play is an unusual mix of tactical wargame-style combat, treasure gathering, and non-combat character teamwork and adventuring, and has no close comparison to other games. Differences between characters are significant, with many having poor fighting skills. Game play and winning is therefore an act of balancing fighting, treasure-gathering and adventuring.

From the game box:

Select a team of characters. Overcome adventures and the enemy team to win favor, achievements, and ultimate victory. And while you are at it, enjoy the stories that your game builds.

Errata (Changes to cards):

An Enemy Turned (Lith Card, Secret): Remove the second paragraph. Enemies cannot be switched if they are imprisoned.

Prince Wallard Blatt (Character): Wallard is killed permanently if he takes damage from anything not caused by a successful Hit. For example, damage from Cube effects or trade damage caused by Hakan. For this purpose, poison damage is caused by a successful Hit.
129459.name: Duel of Ages II

129460.name: Fifteen Minute Baseball
129460.description:
Fifteen Minute Baseball is a quick playing game that captures the essence of baseball in 15-minutes or less. After you have played a few games, you'll be completing games in 5 minutes or less. What makes Fifteen Minute Baseball unique is that is also provides you with the ability to track player stats.
With Fifteen Minute Baseball, you can track stats for your starting pitcher and as many hitters as you’d like. (We recommend 2 or 3 hitters for faster play)

For pitchers, you can track wins, losses, innings pitched, hits allowed, earned runs allowed, walks allowed, and strikeouts.

For hitters, you can track at-bats, runs scored, hits, runs batted in, doubles, triples, home runs, walks, strikeouts, stolen bases, and caught stealing.

Fifteen Minute Baseball contains every element of the "wish list" for a baseball game of this type.

Every Player on the roster counts: check
Offensive and Defensive abilities BOTH count: check
Draft Leagues are possible: check
The game can produce stats for a few or all batters: check
The game covers pitching stats: check
The game plays quickly: check

Fifteen Minute Baseball also makes a complimentary game to your favorite full-play baseball game. You can play out the games you don't want to resolve batter-by-batter with Fifteen Minute Baseball and still have league leaders for pitchers and hitters, as well as accurate standings.

129461.name: Chancellorsville: Bloody May, 1863
129461.description:
Chancellorsville: Bloody May, 1863 is a two-player wargame simulating Jackson’s infamous flank attack that occurred west of the Chancellor House (Chancellorsville) on May 2, 1863. As the Confederate player, you must try to crush Hooker’s unsuspecting army. As the Union player, you must regroup from the initial shock of the blow, hold onto the Chancellor House, and counter-attack against Lee’s outnumbered forces.

Following the debacle at Fredericksburg in December of 1862, President Lincoln replaced Burnside as commander of the Army of the Potomac with Maj. Gen. Joseph Hooker. Hooker came up with one of the most audacious flanking maneuvers of the war. Leaving two corps at Fredericksburg to pin Lee, he would march the rest of his army north and west, cross the Rapidan River, and place himself at Chancellorsville. The move, if successful, would place the Army of Northern Virginia between two Union armies, ready to be crushed as if in a vise. The opening move worked, but then Hooker sat still as if waiting (or daring) for Lee to attack him. Lee did indeed attack. But the move was so unconventional as to catch Hooker completely by surprise. Lee divided his forces in the face of the enemy—a textbook no-no—not once, but twice! First, he left a group at Fredericksburg to delay any Union crossing in that area. Then, with his remaining forces, he left only two divisions in front of Hooker, while the remainder of his army under Jackson (28,000 strong) marched around the Union right and attacked them in the rear at sunset on May 2, 1863.

CBM is an old-fashioned beer and pretzels game that is not burdened with cumbersome command & control or supply rules.

Paul Koenig's Bloody Civil War Series is based upon the intermediate system of Avalon Hill's Gettysburg 1977.

129462.name: Scribbo
129462.description:
From the box

Scribbo It's Bingo With Words
It's as easy as Bingo. Take turns calling out a letter and a number (for example:"A-23"). Ech player write that letter in that number's space on either of his Scribbo grids. The number on your space are arranged differently than on your opponent's space.

With careful letter placement letters turn into words-horizontally and vertically and along the valuable diagonal. You must write down each letter called. Think ahead! You'll need to be clever to protect the words you're trying to make while also trying to block your opponents. Words can be short as one letter and long as five. Play continues until all grids are filled in. High score wins.

129463.description:
The GenCon Indy Promo Card is an exclusive promo card for Legacy: Gears of Time given to people who participated in a demo of the game at GenCon 2012. This technology card is added to the deck and can be played like any other technology, provided the prerequisites to do so are met:


Logic 2
Printing Press 4
Writing
129463.name: Legacy: Gears of Time – GenCon Indy Promo Card

129464.name: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire (Beta)

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

rpgpodcastepisode.102092: Season 2 Episode 1: Regarding the Events of June 6th (Earth)

129464.description:
Publisher's Product Description:

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire is a standalone roleplaying game experience that places players in the roles of hard-hearted bounty hunters, roguish scoundrels, charming smugglers, or fearless explorers trying to survive and thrive on the edges of civilization... and the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire beta test is your chance to be among the first to play! This limited edition, 224-page softcover rulebook provides you a chance to lead a band of explorers and help shape the fate of the galaxy!

More Details:

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire is the first of three epic roleplaying game installments. Each will be a standalone core rulebook, but will complement the other two to form a single game system. Each of these three planned core rulebooks presents the Star Wars galaxy from a different point of view, and they all take place during the height of the Rebel Alliance’s struggle against the Galactic Empire.

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire is the first of these installments, focusing on the fringes of society, the scum and villainy of the galaxy, and the explorers and colonists of the Outer Rim. In this game, players take on the roles of hard-hearted bounty hunters, roguish scoundrels, charming smugglers, or fearless explorers trying to survive and thrive on the edges of civilization.

129465.name: Black Stories 8
129465.description: The game consists of 50 mystery cards. They contain an illustration and a short statement about a spooky or crime event. On the back of the card, the story is presented in more detail. Only one of the players reads the back of the card. The others try to reconstruct how the crime happened by asking yes/no questions.

129466.name: Maths Minus Worry
129466.description:
Card game with 52 cards. There are 10 of each colour, numbered 1 to 10. Plus there are 4 multiplication cards, 4 subtraction cards and 4 dividing cards. The latter three groups are called #Sign' cards.

The rules suggest you may play lots of traditional games with the cards (but I doubt it). The publisher does include the rules to three different games;

Fives
Players must build up a row of five cards that total a number multiplied by five. The normal cards must be of of the same colour but not the sign cards. You do not have to use a sign card if you don't want to. You add and discard cards from your hand as in Rummy games. The first player to reveal a correct hand of five cards, wins that round. The score is one point for each five generated by the total i.e. 20 would score 4, 45 would score 9, and so on. The rules helpfully suggest that the maximum number that could be achieved with five cards is 2,560, and that total would generate 512 points.

Auction Maths
This is a trick taking game and the only game where the colours are ranked; Black, Blue, Green, Red. Black is the lowest ranked colour and Red is the highest.The game is for four players, playing as partners. Both partnerships bid to claim a number of trick (5 being the minimum, 13 the most). Your partner can overcall your bid if he wants to. The player with the winning bid can choose a colour to be the 'Double' suit. This means that every card in that colour counts as if it was doubled (A 4 card would be an 8 card, a x4 card would be a x8 card, and so on). One thing to note, players do not have to follow suit. Any card can be played to any trick. When the calling side wins a trick, it only scores if the four cards played (and in the order the cards were laid) total 25 or more. If not, the trick is laid to one side and doesn't count. You score for each trick made plus a bonus for making your game. The opposition score for every trick by which you fail to make your contract.

Number Building
Players agree before the start of a hand, the total that five cards laid out must achieve. The rules suggest a number under 50 is the wisest choice. Once agreed (before you see your cards), all players will work towards that total. Every player gets 6 cards and must lay a normal number card in front of themselves in the first round. In subsequent rounds a player may draw a card of the deck or a card of the discard pile or can lay a card next to his cards on the table. Once a player has met the total successfully, the hand ends and scoring is based on the small number in the corners of the cards. If you make the total with 5 cards of the same colour, an extra 150 is scored. This bonus reduces if two colours were involved. After an agreed number of hands, the highest total wins.

129467.name: Tiro Finale
129467.description:
Translated from the manual

Tiro Finale is a card game based on Mami's and the Cake Witch's battle in Puella Magi Madoka Magica

The game consists of 2 types of cards, Mami cards representing Mami's power and Witch cards representing the Cake Witch. All cards have a power of 1 to 6.

The game is about being the first to claim that the total of Mami's power (both the open information on the table and the hidden information in each player's hand) is bigger than that of the Witch.

129468.name: Star Wars: Age of Rebellion (AGE)
129468.description:
A fan conversion for Green Ronin's AGE System. Note that this document pre-dates FFG's announcement of a Star Wars RPG of the same name.


From the Introduction:

Star Wars: Age of Rebellion follows the same release format as Green Ronin's Dragon Age RPG did, in that the first two "sets" only take characters up to level 10.

This conversion also assumes familiarity with the AGE rules, and terms like Stunts, TN, Advanced Tests, Armor, Defense, and other AGE mechanical terms are used throughout the document without an explanation as to how they work.

129469.description:
