In the survival action card game Card of the Dead, players are trapped in a town full of zombies; engulfed in the scourge of terror, they must try to survive the zombie horde. Some will frantically seek to flee the city, others will seek to barricade themselves in buildings against the terrible siege. By not getting surrounded, and through the use of both luck and brains(!), you will be able to survive the night.

In game terms, from a deck of cards containing zombies, items and events, players are dealt a hand of cards. Each turn, players draw a card. If the card's a zombie, the player places it in front of himself; if not, he adds the card to his hand and plays one card of his choice. Certain items give the player a chance to flee. The player who first lays down a predetermined number of escape cards – or who is simply the last one alive – wins the game.
129469.name: Card of the Dead

129470.description:
Translated from the manual

All players have spent six depressing years in junior high and high school. The only somewhat colourful memories from those years are the memories together with their childhood friend and the class' top student, Shizuka Miyamoto.

On the graduation day, Shizuka left with the words "I'd liked to have really fallen in love with someone", and a couple of months later, the players are devastated as they hear she has married some guy her parents introduced.

Soon thereafter, the players see an advert recruiting people wanting to participate in a "time-space jump experiment. Only for people with strong minds."

The players participate in the experiment, and use the time machine to try to improve their past. The time machine is powered by strength of mind. The unhappier past, the stronger mind, so at the start, players are able to go back all six years. But as they change the past and get happier, their mind weakens.

Who of the players will be able to catch the heart of Shizuka Miyamoto?
129470.name: Time Traveler's Method

129471.name: The Produce M@ster
129471.description:
Translated from the manual

This is a party card game where the players become 765 producers, trying to send out their idols to different jobs, getting as many jobs as possibel done.

There is no real difference between the different idols, but you can have fun appointing the jobs you wish for your favourite idols.

Based on the video game The Idol m@ster.

129474.description:
User summary

Players represent teams of cats trying to get ahold of the treats being delivered. Treat cards are lined up, with numbers on them, showing which cat(s), in queue order, will get the treat. Players play cat cards with different numbers of cats on them, face down, onto the treat cards. Once all cat cards have been played, the cat cards for each treat are turned face up and points are dealt to the player(s) who have "their" cat in the right position. "Cat Kick" cards will kick away the cat card in front of them.

A half quick game of bluffing and guessing.
129474.name: Cat Kick

129476.name: Territories
129476.description:
User summary

Game consists of 60 cards numbered –3 to +5; all are dealt to the players. Each round, players choose 1–3 cards to put forward face down. They're revealed simultaneously, and the player who have played highest gets the trick. However, the trick is worth the total of all cards, and since there are certain cards that multiply or reverse the value (turn + into -), it's a matter of reading your opponents.

129477.description:
Herptar & Brigandish Mages is an extension box for the Carnage basic game.
Adds two metal miniatures (the magician Brigandish and reptile Herptar), 40 spell stones in two colors and two books of spells.

CARNAGE is a fast, fun, beer-and-pretzels miniature game of fantasy battles between human tribesmen and amphibian Herptar swamp-dwellers. Charge in to battle riding roaring bulls or honking pangolins! Shoot a swarm of arrows with your human or chameleon archers! Hack your foes with human or alligator soldiers!
129477.name: Carnage: Herptar & Brigandish Mages

129478.name: Carnage: Orb of Power & Benny the Bouncer
129478.description:
Carnage - Orb of Power & Benny the Bouncer is an extension box for the Carnage basic game.
Adds two very nice metal miniatures: Benny the Bouncer (almost 7 cm high) and Orb of Power, a pair pulled by two ostrich-like creatures and a card with Orb effects (which take effect after the dice).

CARNAGE is a fast, fun, beer-and-pretzels miniature game of fantasy battles between human tribesmen and amphibian Herptar swamp-dwellers. Charge in to battle riding roaring bulls or honking pangolins! Shoot a swarm of arrows with your human or chameleon archers! Hack your foes with human or alligator soldiers!

129479.name: Klossgubbe
129479.description:
(English "block man") Swedish children's game. Wooden blocks lay face down on the table. In a Memory like fashion players take turns finding the right blocks to build a complete figure. Starting with shoes, then legs and so forth. Several leg or torso pieces can be stacked creating a funny looking final figure.

Supposed to train memory and hand/eye coordination

137773.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Assault on Osgiliath

129480.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Heirs of Númenor transports your games of The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game to the embattled realm of Gondor!

This deluxe expansion introduces 165 new cards, including two new heroes, a host of new allies, and three copies of each player card. With Heirs of Númenor, your heroes can join the might of Gondor in an escalating war against the forces of evil, and three thrilling scenarios lead you from the relative safety of the streets of Pelargir to the heat of an epic battle with an army of Orcs and Southrons.
129480.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Heirs of Númenor

129481.name: Night's Black Agents

rpghonor.20104: 2012 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee

rpgpodcastepisode.185684: Night’s Black Agents: The Thieves Code – Part 1

129481.description:
From the back of the book:

The Cold War is over. Bush’s War is winding down.

You were a shadowy soldier in those fights, trained to move through the secret world: deniable and deadly.

Then you got out, or you got shut out, or you got burned out. You didn’t come in from the cold. Instead, you found your own entrances into Europe’s clandestine networks of power and crime. You did a few ops, and you asked even fewer questions. Who gave you that job in Prague? Who paid for your silence in that Swiss account? You told yourself it didn’t matter.

It turned out to matter a lot. Because it turned out you were working for vampires.

Vampires exist. What can they do? Who do they own? Where is safe? You don’t know those answers yet. So you’d better start asking questions. You have to trace the bloodsuckers’ operations, penetrate their networks, follow their trail, and target their weak points. Because if you don’t hunt them, they will hunt you. And they will kill you.

Or worse.

Night’s Black Agents brings the GUMSHOE engine to the spy thriller genre, combining the propulsive paranoia of movies like Ronin and The Bourne Identity with supernatural horror straight out of Bram Stoker. Investigation is crucial, but it never slows down the action, which explodes with expanded options for bone-crunching combat, high-tech tradecraft, and adrenaline-fueled chases.

Updating classic Gothic terrors for the postmodern age, Night’s Black Agents presents thoroughly modular monstrosity: GMs can build their own vampires, mashup their own minions, kitbash their own conspiracies to suit their personal sense of style and story. Rules options let you set the level of betrayal, grit, and action in your game. Riff from the worked examples or mix and match vampiric abilities, agendas, and assets for a completely custom sanguinary spy saga.

The included hook adventure gets the campaign going; the included city setting shows you what might be clotting in Marseilles’ veins even now. Rack silver bullets in your Glock, twist a UV bulb into your Maglite, and keep watching the mirrors … and pray you’ve got your vampire stories straight.

129482.name: Gut gefragt ist halb gewonnen
129482.description:
Objective: score most winning points by guessing the requested
term (out of creatures, plants, minerals)
- acting by turns -
determine time or no. of winning points game ends with;
one player acts as game master: a card is drawn (randomly);
player is challenged to guess the term =>
A the faster the better the score &
B the lesser questions the better the score
remarks:
published mid/late 1960's

129483.name: The Zalozhniy Quartet
129483.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Gangsters, Smugglers, Arms Dealers… and Vampires.

From the Ukraine, through Vienna and Baghdad, you must fight your way to the top of the conspiracy, past Soviet spies, con men and the supernatural horrors all out for your blood.

The Lisky Bratva, a Russian mafiya brotherhood, will do anything to stop you.

Keep running. Keep fighting. Make that red line on the map a trail of blood.

The Zalozhniy Quartet is a thriller story arc of four missions for your Night’s Black Agents game. Each of the missions can be played individually, or linked into a campaign in any order. The adventures take place in Eastern Europe and the Middle East, the old stomping grounds of Communism and the Cold War… and vampires.

It begins when a conventional investigation goes horribly wrong. A Zalozhniy, a vicious, undead creature, murders your contact and brings you face to face with the Lisky Bratva and a hidden plot to create the Rubedo, the ultimate vampire weapon. In a chase that takes you all the way to the dusty streets of Riyadh and the horrors of the desert, the Lisky Bratva and their spies are always hot on your heels. If you can find the artefect before them, you might just stand a chance of making it out alive.

The Zalozhniy Sanction – The agents are sent to uncover the next step in a gun smuggling operation in Odessa, Ukraine, but the weapons are just one part of the sinister cargo.

Out of the House of Ashes – Soviet spies, old world elegance, covert operations… and vampires. Out of the House of Ashes is the subtle, baroque portion of the quartet. If the agents pull a gun in this operation, they’re already in trouble.

The Boxmen – In this operation, the agents’ target is a safe-deposit box inside a Swiss bank. A team of crooks also have their sights on the box. The agents must either join forces with the criminals, or beat them at their own game.

Treason in the Blood – This operation pits the agents against more supernatural horrors than any other. They’ve got to deal with the legacy of St. John Philby, the Conspiracy’s machinations, and the interference of other, even more mysterious factions who have an interest in the Rubedo.

129484.name: Flip: Plus und Minus
129484.description:
The cards are evenly distributed. Each child puts his cards face down in front of him. Now, in turn, clockwise, the top card of the pile is turned face-down. As soon as two matching cards are on the table: who calls the first flip, wins the pile of his opponent. But beware cards not indetical may look same at first sight.
Last player in game is the winner.

129485.name: Risk Hors Série
129485.description:
A french version of a adaptation of Risk. It revolves around the Mediterranean Basin. You collect armies by controlling territories and land sections.
Battle system revolves around throwing a higher die for the armies involved.
To win, eliminate your opponents.

129486.name: Dark Ages
129486.description:
Dark Ages is an online role-playing game set in a fantasy world of faeries and magic. Dark Ages allows you the player to create your own characters choosing their name, gender, hairstyle, hair color, and path. You can battle monsters as a mighty Warrior, protect and heal as a Priest, use powerful magic as a Wizard, use the devious skills of a Rogue, or discover virtue and power with martial arts as a Monk. Once immersed in the world of Dark Ages, you can partake on quests, discover new lands, defeat powerful monsters, collect rare items and much more.

Dark Ages has a deeply developed community with History, Lore, Philosophy, Literature, and Art all done by creative players like you. You can also become involved in the intricate political and religious system that allows players to interact at a level different from any other game. Players can be involved in one of the deepest online worlds ever created, with faires, markets, theatre, storytelling, contests, an online college and library, interactive politics, religions, rituals, ceremonies and more!

At its heart, Dark Ages offers an experience of adventure and fantasy with an evolving society and story. Your legend begins here!

Source: The Game Website.

129487.name: Flip: Zahlen, Ziffern, Mengen
129487.description:
Shuffle the deck and each player places his cards face down on a pile. The player with the shortest name begins and open his top card. Then the next player open his top card etc.
Different things may happen by opening cards:
1) Someone turns a card already opened by any opponent.
Player who calls "Flip" first gets both card and places them bottom of his deck.
If "Flip" is called wrongly, the penalty is discarding one of his card to flip-pot deck.
2) Card shows dice. Player rolls it and the dice shows action to player must do:
Change the direction, take the flip-pot, take all open cards from table, exchange Your discard pile with chosen opponent's discard pile etc.

Game lasts to pre-agreed time-limit. Winner is the player with the most cards.

129488.name: Le fleau des dieux
129488.description:
Le fleau des dieux is based on a French comics translated in English in 2008 by Marvel ("Scourge of the Gods"). The theme of this game is a mix of both Space conquest and a the ancient Roman empire.

The game sets the players into conflict for the control of the galaxy. The victory is achieved if a player control a chain of five planets or seven in total (without the chain condition). The first phase consist of dividing the planets among all players, then you will fight to gain more.

At the beginning of his turn player should choose one of his planet, other player can do the same to participate in the fight.

The combat system is based on two type of cards :

units (with attack values depending on the field)
special cards




The winner will choose two planets participating to the fight and then each other player will choose one (except the last who will get nothing).

129489.name: All for One: Régime Diabolique (Savage Worlds)
129489.description:
From the back of the book:

EN GARDE! FIGHT FOUL BEASTS OF THE NIGHT!

The year is 1636 and France is a troubled nation. A great and terrible evil gnaws at its core and darkness stalks the land.

All that stands between chaos and order are the King’s Musketeers.

Explore a France of swashbuckling action, powerful magic, daring deeds, courtly intrigue, witty repartee, and vile monsters! The characters are France’s bravest and proudest defenders, the King’s Musketeers. Pitted against them is a plethora of corrupt nobles, black magicians, fell demons, and twisted secret societies. Set at the height of power of Cardinal Richelieu and Louis XIII, All for One: Régime Diabolique mixes the action of literary works such as The Count of Monte Cristo and The Three Musketeers with horror and intrigue to create a unique, vibrant setting.

Strap on your sword, salute the King, and prepare to cross swords with the creatures of darkness!

This version of All for One: Régime Diabolique is a musketeer roleplaying setting for Savage Worlds RPG.

boardgamecompilation.170245: Spartacus: Champions of House Batiatus Card Set

129490.description:
Special promo gladiator card to add to your ludis.

Bolster the gladiators at your command with Dolor, one of the legendary combatants who fought in the arena of Capua before Spartacus, Crixus or Gannicus battled on the sands and became legends.

Special power: Opponent subtracts 4 from their total initiative.
129490.name: Spartacus: Dolor Promo Card

128671.name: Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery

129491.name: Fresh Biz
129491.description:
FreshBiz is a game that fundamentally changes the way its participants play their business and life by simulating and then practicing new, creative methods of entrepreneurial thinking, and problem solving to achieve their most vital goals.

Through its game-based learning, participants travel through the game on a mission to win, while gaining skills, understandings and strategies that not only help them to achieve the goals in the game, but also to excel in their lives.

Utilizing common business practices, and years of insight from entrepreneurs, FreshBiz uses tools such as the buying & selling of businesses, leveraging, negotiations, loans, business opportunities and more to simulate a business environment. Simultaneously, relationships are being forged and the atmosphere of the room buzzes as participants engage with themselves and others in entrepreneurial, multi-dimensional thinking.

Insights gained during a 60 to 90-minute game last far into the future, as our participants claim that the game impacts them for the rest of their lives. There is a distinction between change and transformation. Working harder, doing something less, spending more time else, etc are change, while transformation through FreshBiz is what shifts your paradigm completely and offers you the opportunity to play business, relationships, and life in a whole new way.

As you play FreshBiz, your goal is to reach the "Winner" lot in 90 minutes. In order to achieve your objective, as you pass from section to section (paying tolls to pass), you will have to handle different business dimensions and practice entrepreneurial skills.

The Businesses
In order to pay tolls as you cross through the board on the way to the Island, you will need to earn money. One of the many ways to do that is by starting businesses. Each player gets different businesses cards and each business card has an establishment cost and a profit. You will have to be creative and smart in handling your budget, cash flow, and strategy in order to turn your original capital into the profits you need to move ahead in the game.

Action Cards

Just as in life, each player starts the game with their own unique set of Action Cards. Essentially, these are your gifts, talents and special abilities in the game. It's up to you to use them in the best way possible, and they can be played during any turn. So, be creative and you will make money and friends The Stock Market, Loans, & Partnerships As you go through the game, there will be many business dimensions that you can leverage to help you win, such as the Stock Market, Loans, Partnerships and more...
The more dimensions you master the better results you will get and the more fun you will have...in FreshBiz and in life! So go win!

129492.description:
In Bee Alert, a.k.a. Honigbienchen, six colored plastic bees are hidden below six beehives with players initially knowing which bees are where.

On a turn, the active player draws a card. If it's a hive card, she takes a hive from the middle without lifting it up; if it's a bear card, she returns one hive to the middle of the table; if it's a bee card, she lifts one hive to reveal the bee. If the bee matches the color on the card, she moves the hive towards herself.

The first player with four hives wins! Alternatively, when the cards run out, whoever has the most hives in front of her wins.
129492.name: Bee Alert

129493.name: Bloons Tower Defense 5
129493.description:
Another awesome track update is here, this time an expert track called Drag Strip! The bloons have invaded the local monkey Drag Strip and are trying to stop the race, so don't let them get to the end and ruin everything. Careful placement and attention to tower ranges are essential on this short, two-path track. Check out the hilarious monkey dragsters in the background and pick up new medals and Awesome when you win. Bloons TD5 has heaps of new features including all of your favourite towers from BTD4 with 8 awesome upgrades each instead of 4, and two brand new never before seen tower types. So much new awesomeness: tower upgrades with cool Super Activated Abilities, new Bloon types, fun new tracks with moving parts and tunnels, powerful Special Agent towers, daily rewards, and daily challenges - a fun new challenge to play each and every day! Updates are coming all the time, and your progress is tracked for ranks, upgrades, and achievements when you log in using our new NK login system. Have fun!

Source: The Developer Website.

129494.description:
The semi-educational game of time travel and abduction!

Evil Baby Orphanage is a communal deck party card game for three or more players. Each player takes on the role of a Time Nanny using advanced time out technology to rid the time stream of the world's worst villains and "prehabilitate" them to be accountants, or ballerinas, or something.

Heinrich Himmler is a "Babbling" Promo Card. If left unsupervised each other Time-Nanny to your left and right get to draw 1 Nanny-Card
129494.name: Evil Baby Orphanage: Heinrich Himmler Promo Card

129496.name: Bloons Tower Defense 5 Deluxe
129496.description:
Finally, the ultimate Bloons Tower Defense experience comes to your Desktop! Assemble your monkeys to fight back against the endless waves of invading Bloons. Unlock dozens of amazing tower upgrades, deploy powerful special agents, and enjoy the unparalleled strategic depth of Ninja Kiwi's Bloons TD 5. BTD5 Deluxe features full-screen, high-resolution offline play and includes never before seen content including awesome new towers, tracks, and agents.

Source: The Developer Website.

129497.description:
The semi-educational game of time travel and abduction!

Evil Baby Orphanage is a communal deck party card game for three or more players. Each player takes on the role of a Time Nanny using advanced time out technology to rid the time stream of the world's worst villains and "prehabilitate" them to be accountants, or ballerinas, or something.

Nero is a "Bully" Promo Card. If left unsupervised these Evil Babies shove an Evil baby from another Orphanage. Choose any Time-Nanny, that Time-Nanny must select one of their Evil Babies and give it to a Time-Nanny to their Left or Right.
129497.name: Evil Baby Orphanage: Nero Promo Card

129498.name: Bloons Tower Defense 4 Expansion
129498.description:
NOW UPDATED WITH NEW THE NEW TOWERS!

Use your favourite new towers, the Dartling Gun and the Spike Factory in this awesome expansion pack for BTD4. Bloons Tower Defense 4 Expansion contains 4 brand new crazy fun tracks for you to try out. Mesmerise yourself on the Sandy Spiral Track, get lost in the Subterrainian Sewers, explore the secrets of the Monkey Temple, or challenge your wits on the Triangle of Insanity! This expansion also includes a new game mode called Deflation mode. You start Deflation mode with 50,000 money but you never get any more. Finally, we have included Tower Specialties, which you will unlock after completing the new tracks in various difficulty levels. The specialties allow you to customize your strategy by making some towers much cheaper to buy, at the expense of increasing the cost of all others. Enjoy Bloons Tower Defense 4 Expansion only on Ninja Kiwi!

Source: The Developer Website.

129499.name: A Modest Inclination toward Speed
129499.description:
The road ahead beckons, and you want to run the course from start to finish as quickly as possible before you run out of gas. But looking ahead, some of those curves are a little steep. Perhaps it is best not to drive too fast.

Each turn you play one card from your hand, adjust your speed accordingly, and move over the appropriate number of road sections. Taking a curve too fast or a jump too slow results in damage which is paid by discarding player cards. If you cross the finish line card, you win. If you run out of cards or are unable to take enough damage, you lose.

Created for the 2012 Solitaire Print and Play Contest

129500.name: Crash Dive!
129500.description:
Summary taken from the module:

THE PREMISE: A desperate group of sailors aboard a damaged American submarine that is leaking oil must somehow escape to safety with several German destroyers converging on their location. Radio contact will only clue the Germans on to them as well as possibly provoke another air strike.

129001.name: Payday: The Heist – Wolfpack
129001.description:
User Summary

The first DLC for Payday include two new Heists (Counterfeit and Undercover), a new skilltree (the Tech), new weapons and equipment.

In order to play the DLC only the host of the session has to own it. All three other players can join in on the heists without paying for the DLC.

129002.name: Liber Fanatica Volume IX: Perils of the Empire
129002.description:
from the Liber Fanatica website

Welcome to Liber Fanatica Issue #9 – Perils of the Empire, Part 1. It is supplemental material dedicated to Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay 3rd edition. It contains articles for both players and gamemasters as well as a number of new adventures. Part II, a longer adventure with a rich background article will be published as a separate addition to the volume at a later date.
However, Part 1 can be used completely without Part 2 and it can be downloaded from the Liber Fanatica website

Table of Contents:

The General Section:
Foreword p.4
Imperial Gazetteer – the World of Trade Expanded p. 5-16
Chaos at the Table – Bring Those Problem Players Back to Sigmar p.17-24

The GM’s section:
Mordheim – Adventuring in the City of the Damned p. 25-44
The Wayward Son and Other Short Stories
– Short Adventures Knit together and in Separate Morsels p. 45-55
Cheap Tickets – A Harrowing Morging After p.56-60
Hand of Glory – Master of Shadows-Campaign Part II p. 61-83
Appendices – p.84-5

The Pull-Out Section
Cards for LF9 articles in Part 1 (separate download link)

129003.name: Deponia
129003.description:
User Summary

Deponia is a graphical adventure about a world in which almost everything degenerated to waste. Where the rich live on the top and the poor in the filth in the lower levels.

The player controls Rufus who tries to gain access to the upper levels to live the life he dreamed of his whole childhood. But he falls in love with the beautiful girl Goal which only causes trouble.

129004.name: The Ganymede Job
129004.description:
From the back cover and introduction:

You prefer to call yourselves freelance specialists. Others prefer to call you corporate mercenaries, but what’s in a name? Besides, the pay is good, and as the man once said: It’s a dirty job but someone’s got to do it.

On face value it looked like a juicy contract: infiltrate a corporate lab on Ganymede and steal an item of interest to your employers. A simple piece of corporate espionage. You go in, you grab the goods, and you get out.
You thought all you had to fear was getting caught. You were wrong. Very wrong...

The Ganymede Job is a short Cthulhu Rising adventure designed to be played by a group of up to 6 players in one gaming
session. It is a prequel to Escape Velocity from the Chaosium monograph Jovian Nightmares, and owning this publication is
a distinct advantage to Keepers.

129005.name: Trimm-Dich-Spiel
129005.description:
Be the first to get from start to goal with 3 game-pieces by rolling dice, hit special areas and do exercises that are drawn from a deck of exercise-cards along the way.

Every player gets 3 pieces in the same colour that are placed on the matching start-fields. The youngest player starts the game, roll a die and move one piece at a time. When you reach an exercise- spot, draw a card an do what it says. Then draw a "grading" card to see the verdict on your "performance" and get a bonus or a set back. Along the route there are also arrows that you want to hit/not hit in order to get to goal faster.

129006.name: World War 3: The Board Game
129006.description:
This is a turn-based strategic world domination game with economic/industrial, resource and military planning components. It is currently a proposed Kickstarter project.

There are three main layers to WW3. The first is industrial/economic production. Control the centers of industry, and you earn their production points. However, such control can be gained either through economic investment OR military adventurism. To invade or to invest, that is the question!

The second layer is fuel and resource production. Fuel helps your armies move faster, and your fleets to move MUCH faster. But use up all your fuel on movement, and you may not have much left over for battle. Remember that an army fighting without fuel will be struggling for its very survival.

The final layer to game play is, of course, the military dimension. The basic version of the game will have two types of military units: armies and fleets. Unlike in Risk, where ridiculous numbers of armies start crowding the board very quickly, WW3 forces you to make tough choices with limited military forces. The loss of just one critical army at a key moment could prove lethal; every strategic choice in this game is critical.

129007.name: Nürburg-Rennen
129007.description:
Objective: be the first crossing finish line (between space '60' and '1')
- moving by turns -
players agree no. of laps first.
Simple die rolling game. From the start, you move round the track, obeying instructions on special squares (red, green, yellow). The first player crossing the finish line wins.
remarks:
published 1930's

129008.name: Jadeclaw Character Design Book
129008.description:
From publisher blurb:

Contains only the character-creation rules for JADECLAW: ANTHROPOMORPHIC FANTASY ROLE-PLAY.

Enter the world of Zhongguo, where Dragons and Phoenixes live among Cats, Rats, Dogs, and dozens of other races … Where the Celestial Bureaucracy governs not only the Noble Houses of Earth, but also the Heaven Court and even the weather itself … Where adventure can be found from the uncharted wilderness, to the Forbidden City of Majing, and all places in between.

129009.name: B-Movie Hero
129009.description:
B-Movie Hero is a push your luck dice and card game with a little bit of strategy thrown in.
Your goal, as a lowly B-Movie hero, is to kill as many monsters as you can to survive. This means you will have to barricade yourself in whatever relatively safe place you can find, scavenge around for supplies, and of course, duct tape multiple weapons together to create one massive weapon of destruction that by all means should not work, but does.

How do you accomplish this goal is simple. Each turn a card is flipped over from the Situation Deck. These cards contain global effects that help/hinder your dice rolling, or supply locations for you to clear out and possibly barricade yourself in for added protection.

Once this is done, 3 dice are grabbed at random from a group of 12. The dice contain everything from weapons to barricades to scavenging abilities and killing sprees. The dice are rolled and placed aside for points, barricades, weapons, etc... But if you roll 3 "Bite" symbols before voluntarily ending your turn, you lose any points you might have gained. Play continues until somebody reaches the agreed upon victory points to win the game.

129010.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Deep in the jungle of the mysterious Oobydoobies, high atop the Cliff of Frab, your expedition has discovered an incredible treasure that will grant the owner amazing power! But, what's this? No one in your group wants to share the treasure! Use your supplies, your wits, and some ancient magic left by the Oobydoobies to build a path to the top of the Cliff of Frab. Crush, roast, or explode your opponents, and try to claim the treasure before anyone else!

Jungle Ascent is a racing game in which players must build a pathway up the perilous Cliff of Frab with ladders, bridges, and conveyor belts while sending opponents tumbling down with hazards such as Fireballs and Crushers. Action cards such as Speed Juice and Construction will also make players' lives a bit easier during the climb.

The first player to scale to the top of the Cliff of Frab claims its untold treasures and wins the game!
129010.name: Jungle Ascent

129011.name: Over the Edge: 20th Anniversary Edition 1992-2012
129011.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This limited printing of the enhanced Over the Edge 2nd Edition core book celebrates the 20th anniversary of Over the Edge, the seminal roleplaying game of surreal danger that changed the way RPGs are played.

The Over the Edge 20th Anniversary Edition Features:

· Limited Edition: The printing is of only 400 of this collector's item. The books are individually numbered, and signed by game designer Jonathan Tweet, on an attractive color bookplate.

· Deluxe Binding: Featuring a dark blue leatherette hardcover with gold foil stamped logo and high-quality smythe sewing.

· Premium Interior: A NEW 16-page full-color section introduces the book, while the interior is a reprint of the B&W 2nd Edition on premium coated paper stock.

· Exclusive Extras: The new introduction includes essays by Jonathan Tweet, Robin Laws, Greg Stolze, Keith Baker, and John Nephew. Plus a newly commissioned 2-page full-color map of the island of Al Amarja and quotes from fans.

129012.description:
Expands the original game for up to 7 players; includes new equipment cards; includes new dictator cards.

Cool Factors:
Adds three extra players to the base game.
Introduces new dictator chaos including the assassin!
Doubles the equipment over the base game.
Description:
MERC is a strategy game where each player hires and controls a team of mercenaries working co-operatively against an evil dictator.

MERC: The Expansion is an expansion for MERC that allows you to play with up to 6 players plus a dictator. It doubles the amount of available equipment, nearly doubles the size of the map, doubles the encounters, nearly doubles the amount of MERCs, and increases the amount of chaos the dictator can unleash dramatically.

This expansion requires the base game of MERC

boardgameversion.175465: The Game Crafter English First edition

129012.name: MERC: The Expansion

boardgameimplementation.150012: No Retreat 3: The French and Polish Fronts

129013.description:
Deluxe Series #6

Following on the success of No Retreat! where the Russian Front of World War II beckons, and then taking the action to the African Front, game designer Carl Paradis and his trusty developer Alan Emrich have teamed up yet again to present the third chapter in this game series, No Retreat 3: The French Front.

The “Phony War” ended in May of 1940 as the German Army unleashed blitzkrieg attacks into Holland, Belgium and Luxembourg in preparation for their audacious plan to invade France. Dubbed “Case Yellow” (Fall Gelb), it relied on a surprise attack with armored forces through the Ardennes Forest that the French had deemed impenetrable. A German staff study proved otherwise, and their panzers were pushed through this broken wooded terrain with deft speed, catching the Allies by surprise with their appearance.

In No Retreat 3, players command the Allied (French and British) or German forces, operating them in accordance to one of several historical plans (represented by Plan cards). Maneuvering forces over hexes that are approximately 30 kilometers across, over turns that represent 4 days of real time each, the vaunted No Retreat series card-assisted game systems are there to create on-map puzzles around each hex, unit and battle as the tense engagements rage back-and-forth and nothing is entirely predictable.

Designer Carl Paradis has made an exhaustive study to answer the question, “Could France have staved off total defeat in 1940?” His research yields a resounding, “Yes!,” and the simulation elements of No Retreat 3, combined with its novel gameplay elements, offer a rich and insightful presentation of this controversial military campaign that shaped the trajectory of World War II.

Game Data:

Complexity: 5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is one army: The German forces or the Allied forces (French, British, and Neutrals) Each hex is about 30 kilometers from side to side. Each turn represents four days of real time, except the first turn, which is only two days.

Components:

Full-color, 24-page rules book
8.5" x 11" Player Aid Mat
2 two-sided 8.5" x 5.5" Player Aid sheets (1 German and 1 French)
11" x 17" game map
117 thick, two-sided, multi-shaped game pieces
37 Event and Plan cards
129013.name: No Retreat 3

129014.description:
Objective: get rid of most 'Olchi'-chips, evenly distributed
- acting by turns -
a garbage dump is prepared by placing cards = 'Olchi' items and oil drums (fire supplies for the dragon) vertically into board & box; next to the box 11 digging chips have to be placed.
Active player rolls the coloured die and turns the box in a way, looking at the matching colour (=digger) or oil drum; using the 'Olchi' tongs a card has to be drawn: an 'Olchi' item? => drop one of your chips; an oil drum? remove a digging chip;
if the die showed an oil drum symbol the dragon requires supply: now the player should draw an 'oil drum' card instead...
Game ends if all digging chips are gone; in case that a player dropped all his 'Olchi' chips game ends at once.
129014.name: Die Olchis ziehen um

129015.name: Eggzilla
129015.description:
Children's motorized action game. Part of a series of games entitled T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hilarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. This is "Godzilla" or "Kaiju" themed game . The goal is to cover Eggzilla in a plastic egg before he jumps off the base. The timer is started by pushing Eggzilla down, firmly, onto the base. The game is won when the top of the egg is pushed down onto Eggzillas head, stopping the timer.

From the box: "Piece the egg together before the monster hatches!"

Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players.

129016.name: Flip-O-Potamus
129016.description:
Children's motorized action game. Part of a series of games entitled T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hilarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. This is a hippopotamus themed game with a pop-a-shot mechanic. The goal is to flip all 8 plastic marbles into the hippos mouth before the time stops. The hippos mouth opens and closes while the player attempts to shoot in all the marbles.

From the box: "Flip the hippo a mouthful of marbles!"

Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players.

129017.name: Ironclaw Ninth Anniversary Edition
129017.description:
From publisher blurb:

The premier anthropomorphic RPG just got even better! IRONCLAW Ninth Anniversary edition includes all the material from the classic game, plus the critically-acclaimed RINALDI and more! Fight with swords, with guns, with spells, or even with your bare teeth and claws as the kingdoms of old collapse and evil rises up in the dark shadows.

129018.name: Grabbit
129018.description:
Children's motorized action game. Part of a series of games entitled T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hilarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. Amphibian themed game that uses a rotating tree to spin mosquitos towards the frog. The goal is to make the frog grab up all 6 bugs before the timer stops. When the time stops the tree pops off the base.

From the box: "Grab the bugs before the time stops and the tree pops!"

Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players.

129019.name: Yuke! Nobunaga Kashindan
129019.description:
Multi-players game for vassals of Oda Nobunaga in Sengoku period of Japan. Oda Nobunaga was most powerful daimyo(feudal lord) in Sengoku period.
"Yuke! Nobunaga Kashindan" is means Go! Nobunaga's Vassals.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oda_Nobunaga

Each player control one major vassals in Oda clan.
Standard game can play from three to five players. The game also include rule for one(solitaire) and two players.

Each counter represents a vassal to serve Oda clan. Each vassal have three ability, military, castellation and politic. During in the game, players can recruit vassals to own faction.

Each card represents a mission be ordered from Oda Nobunaga. Each mission has victory points, necessary abilities and penalty of failure.

Elect chief vassal at the beginning of each turn. Then, chief vassal is draw mission cards and he assigns missions to each player. Players can negotiate freely for achieve mission.
Repeat until the mission is exhausted.

Winner is determined by victory points.

129020.description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of your cards
- acting by turns/simultaneously -
there are 9 different type of 'Olchi' cards: each card requires a specific action;
each player gets the same amount of cards (9), shuffles them and forms a hidden staple; active player places his top card upon the centre of the table and flips it => all players should perform required action, e.g. yawning, grunting...
if all perform correctly: next player's turn; a player who fails must take all the cards out of the centre.
Special card 'garbage': all players try - as fast as possible -
to cover that card with their hand; the 'top' hand takes all cards...
129020.name: Die Olchis sind da  card game

129021.description:
The wars with the Grayking have taken their toll. Lassadar's defenses are not as they once were, the Wardens are greatly reduced in number and magic is seemingly drained from the land.

From the South now arises a new threat. Twelve dread barons have formed a pact and pledged to take Lassadar for their own. They have gathered their armies and new allies - the Trulls, hulking brutes that hurl stones like mobile catapults - and have come north to Dalnish, a border city and first line of defense against invasion, to lay siege.

The Tower of Dalnish stands ready to repel the invasion but supplies and soldiers are limited. As the Captain of the Guard, it is your responsibility to hold out long enough for reinforcements to arrive. Rally your men, ready your weapons. They are upon you.....

A solo tower siege game lasting about 20 minutes and is the first game in the 2nd Lassadar game trilogy.

You, and the forces you command, must hold out long enough until Reinforcements arrive (drawn from the Event deck). If you can succeed in this you will drive the Barons and their armies back across the Southern border. If all of your Tower’s battlements are destroyed by Enemy Units or all of your Tower Units are slain or destroyed you lose the game and Lassadar is invaded.

42 cards, divided into Defensive Units, Enemy Units and Events are payed on a 2 section game board. Each Unit has a set of attack and defensive values. Using Action Points units played by the player can be deployed, engaged and repaired.

Unique to this game are Damage Pattern footprints that players must use effectively to combat Enemy Units.

A series of Event cards act as an AI in the game changing game play as the rounds progress. These cards are drawn when sufficient damage is done to the Enemy Units

Dice counters have been provided along with the card files/player board. Players may substitute 8mm dice if they prefer.

1st Place - Best Science Fiction/Fantasy Themed Game - 2012 Solitaire PNP Contest
2st Place - Best Artwork for an Entered Game Category - 2012 Solitaire PNP Contest
Grand Prize - 2012 Solitaire PNP Contest
129021.name: Shadows Upon Lassadar: Siege at Dalnish

129022.name: Shiver: Vanishing Hitchhiker
129022.description:
After leaving something in your car, a hitchhiker vanishes! Track her down and return her things in Shiver: Vanishing Hitchhiker! Explore a spooky landscape as you figure out where the mysterious woman has gone in this exciting Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. Dive into a deeper mystery as you progress through incredible locations and scenes!

Source: The Publisher Website.

129023.name: Batman (1990/TG-16)
129023.description:
User Description

Among the many games that were released to go along with the 1989 Batman movie was the unique TurboGrafx-16 Batman game. Whereas most Batman games of the era were side-scrolling beat-'em-ups, this Batman game requires the player to collect numerous items on small, maze-like floors within a time limit before moving on to other floors.
